conclusion: Determine whether the displacements of cars A and B are the same during the time interval from t=0 to t=t1 by analyzing their velocity-time graphs.
Graph A represents the velocity-time graph of Car A.
Graph B represents the velocity-time graph of Car B.
Graph A shows that Car A's velocity decreases from v1 to v2 over time.
Graph B shows that Car B's velocity also decreases from v1 to v2 over time.
Both graphs show that Car A and Car B have the same velocity at t=t1.
The graphs differ in the rate of decrease of velocity over time.
Displacement is the change in position over time.
For Car A, the displacement is the difference between the final position (v2) and the initial position (v1).
For Car B, the displacement is the difference between the final position (v2) and the initial position (v1).
For Car A: Initial position: v1, Final position: v2, Displacement = v2 - v1.
For Car B: Initial position: v1, Final position: v2, Displacement = v2 - v1.
Since both graphs show that Car A and Car B have the same velocity at t=t1, the difference in their displacements is zero.
The displacements of Car A and Car B are the same during the time interval from t=0 to t=t1.
Yes, the displacements of cars A and B are the same during the time interval from t=0 to t=t1.
